annotation.TEXT: Reimu's Trick Mansion
MOOOOOONNNS!!!!! ...Oh, but I appear to be trapped...?
I wonder if I'll be playing this level eventually...
Okay, so what can I do here? I can kill myself on the munchers, or I can kill myself in the pit...
Just made it. Oh, hey there, Birdo! Huh, I can't pick up the egg, but I can ride it!

Also, with this being a Japanese hack, it's got Japanese text, of course. If anyone wants to translate the text for me, that would be great! UPDATE: 8azaz22 provided a translation document that I'll be using, which I've linked to in the description.
BGM: Sonic the Hedgehog - Spring Yard Zone
Whoa, careful. I should switch to my flower so that I can fry that Parakoopa.
...Wait for it...

Oh, I definitely know this music, since I often use it for the main overworld in my SMW challenge videos! Okay, so we've got Yoshi's House and a red level to begin with. I guess I'll start with Yoshi's House, as usual.
Okay, let's go get that key.
Oh, nuts! The balloon is needed to proceed from here, and I ended up wasting it!
Hakurei Shrine 1 (Easy)
Huh, I just noticed that I'm called "Marisa", not "Mario".
Well, anyway, I've rewound to back here, since I was stuck without a balloon again. Alright, so if I can't grab the eggs, how do I kill Birdo?
...Assuming the Bob-omb cooperates...

Yeah, I often like doing this in SMB2 while riding a Birdo egg or Beezo. If you walk in the direction that the object you're on is travelling without pressing the run button, you'll sorta "skip" on the upper corner of what you're riding, but won't fall. This is particularly useful with SMB2's Beezos, because you'll slide off of them if you don't move at all.
That unlocked a level to the east, which has the same name, except with no keyhole symbol, and an "N" instead of an "E". Normal difficulty, I assume.
And, there we go. The secret exit has been gotten.
Well, there's some Japanese text already. If anyone translates it for me, I'll annotate in the translations. UPDATE: Red annotations containing the translations have been added.
Okay, this time I'll head right, but I'm not going to use the left+right glitch. However, I will try to fix the camera.

Also, the level to the north has the same name, except with a "2" instead of a "1", and also no keyhole symbol. So, which level should I play next? 2(E), or 1(N)? Place your votes now! To be continued... Ze!
It was called Mysterious Super Mario World, and its development returned peace to the world.
Huh. I can actually move around, but I can't really go anywhere.
Whoa, Yin-Yang Orbs that bounce just like Tweeters do. However, they're totally stompable.
Demo count: 1
Hakurei Shrine 1 (Normal)
Yep, there's the keyhole, but where's the key? ...Uh, oh.
So, I take it the normal goal is just over here, right?
And now that I've jumped up here, I can't go back down to where I started. BTW, is Marisa holding a blue Playstation controller?
Hi, Yoshi!
NOTICE: I've removed the content ID matched audio from this point to about 3:45.
More instructions, perhaps?
Alright, now I'm just gonna let this title demo finish...
Aw, that's just the block that had the power up I got earlier. Well, that's a bust.
Dude, a cape! That was totally worth it!
There's the first Yoshi coin. I will be trying to get every Yoshi coin, of course.
WHEEEE!!!
Oh, what?! Why did I die? Maybe those turn blocks were not the spinning type. (Also, when I died, the fireplace smoke clouds started spazzing out up there.)
BGM: Mega Man 2 - Intro and Title Screen
So, if you guys want to play this hack, I strongly advise you to use the download link in this video's description, which has the F-bomb removed.
These orbs are neither flammable nor inflammable.
Heh. I changed the Bob-omb explosion into a coin.
In the year 200X, Dr. Pyua* gave the world a Mario hack. (* Or "Pure," but he spells it that way so hey whatever.)
Okay, screw it. I probably don't need the mushroom power up anyway, so I'll just take the 1-up from the key.
Okay, I'm really curious what's over here, so... Hey, munchers, you get a free nibble this time!
Pyua, Hokkaido, Fantasy Fun Group. (Translations provided by a document that 8azaz22 linked to. I've put the link to that document in the video description.)
There's a ? block. I wonder if I should've gotten off there.
Hmm... I haven't seen any power ups here yet... There are power ups in this hack besides that mushroom in Yoshi's House, right?
Stages with a lock after the name signify a key goal, or otherwise-other exit. Alternate exits might lead to the next difficulty level or to a different world.
Pfft... The Parakoopa despawned. Whatever.

Yeah, I'm boned. Seriously, a section that can be made unwinnable in the first level, simply because I decided to follow the wrong arrow? And why couldn't there be a reset door or pipe? Okay, I'm going to space-time rewind here!
However, Dr. Pyua began plotting a Touhou Project Mario hack, and so that dream changed,
Whoa, that character is red. It must be important.
Huh, the title demo apparently collected exactly 100 coins.
Space-time rewind count: 2
And here we have a giant Marisa with a creepy look on her face, and Mario standing on top of this Mega Man 2 intro building.
Huh, that took a while to load for some reason.
Just like that, I've found the fourth and fifth Yoshi coins. And, I also found... the key... Argh... I know how to get the secret exit now. I'll come back for it on my second visit.
Hakurei Shrine 2 (Easy)
Maidens are praying...
Whoa! ...Well, bye, Yoshi!

Oh, and that file there is from when I checked to make sure the F-bomb actually was removed from the castle destruction cutscenes, so yes, I have played a little ways in, but of course I'll be starting a new game now.
Okay, not every enemy's black outline is red. These Goombas and Pokey look normal. Also, the Chucks earlier looked normal as well.
KA-BOOOOM!!!
Sure looks like Mario is my player character, though. Anyway, this unlocks a level to the north, but of course, I'm going back for the secret exit, at ludicrous speed!
Alright, let's get this game started!
For whatever stupid reason, in the castle destruction cutscenes in this hack, the egg says an F-bomb. Yeah, that's really dumb, especially since this hack is Japanese.
No idea what's over there, but I don't feel like being OMNOMNOM-ed right now.
Uh, oh! Hurry!
Zwee!
So, is there anything of interest way over here?
There's an arrow pointing right, but if I go left, there's an arrow pointing left. I bet that's where the secret exit is, so I'll head that way.
Darned if I know what that actually says, so I'll just be referring to this hack as "Scarlet Devil Mario", which is what I think most people call it.
Yeah, I took that hit on purpose just to get the free embiggening anyway.
And that's the end of the line. So, where was that ? block that I just passed?
..."Mario something something something something something something Marisa something something something"!
Finally, a power up!
I did get to burninate a Ninji, so there's that at least.
Key-Goal Hint: 1: Birdo. 2: The keyhole is above the midpoint. There might be a special something else, too.
Okay, to speed things up some more, I will use the left+right glitch this time.
Space-time rewind count: 1
Well, I just found a hidden mushroom. And, this message seems to be listing three things. Maybe they're instructions on how to get 18 lives here, but I don't know.
Ooh, a P-balloon!
Yep, there it is. Those are some weird colors used for the left side of the goal post.
Sacrificial horse count: 1
and new production began on Scarlet Devil Mansion Mario... (The red character is "Scarlet".)

I wonder if there's a palette error in this level, because the normally black outlines on the enemies are red, and the Ninjis are totally red as well. Also, when I got that 1-up earlier, the normally black outlines on the "1UP" symbol were red, too.
...Or, I can discover that there's an unseeable floor down here, which gives me a clever idea...
So, something about a doctor (assuming that's what "Dr." stands for), and something about Touhou Project...
Okay, forget it. I don't know why the camera tends to become unfriendly like that while ballooning...
I'll definitely take that 1-up, to replace the life I just lost.
...Okay, so Birdo's stomp-killable in this hack.
Mario's Challenge from Marisa at the Scarlet Devil Mansion
Ah, so this is probably how I find the key... maybe. (I did watch raocow play through this hack, but that was a long time ago, and I don't remember everything about it.)
...Aww... If I had known midpoint was right there, I would've waited until after hitting it to get that power up, because of the free embiggening that midpoint grants if I hit it while small.
I wonder if this is explaining that the keyhole symbol means that there is a keyhole exit in this level, or just that the level has two exits...
In the background, I see the Hakurei Shrine and a lot of pink trees with silly smiles on them.
I saw that Piranha Plant. I also see a ? block!
Oh, noes. I missed three coins while crossing those munchers. Whatever will I do? (Said in a monotone voice.)
Hello, this is SomeGuy712x, and I'm starting a new SMW hack, which is called...
Okay, pressing Select made this message that I can't read appear. I'll generally leave each of these messages on the screen for several seconds each.
However, fairly recently, adakkusu-san was able to remove that F-bomb for me, changing it back to the usual "Thank you!", so now I'm perfectly fine playing this hack.

...Really? There was a power up right here at the start all this time? Looking back, I missed it because of the way I bounced off of the koopas on these light poles, which didn't allow the screen to scroll up enough for me to see the ? block.
Hmm... If I can double-grab the key and the Bob-omb, I can get both a 1-up and a regular mushroom for crossing the goal here.
- Caution - 1. Don't jump around where you can't see! 2. There's a time limit! 3. If you collect even one moon and leave, they'll all be gone when you come back!
Marisa: "Who's this Pyua guy, and what'd he make? Whatever! I'm challenging the legendary Mario, ze! Mario, you're comin' into Gensokyo!" Mario: "Oh man, I'm starting to get a little excited!"
Careful. I don't want to kill Birdo this time.
I would've had a flower at this point the first time had I not missed the first power up then.
Alright, let's begin our adventure!
Reimu: "The owner is away, so this place has been turned into a trick mansion..." Here, you can get up to 18 lives and a Fire Flower. You can leave by dying, but you can also leave out the sides.
Huh, I just noticed that I'm called "Marisa", not "Mario".
Well, this message mentions "18UP", so maybe you can get a total of 18 lives here. And, maybe there's a hint as to how, but I have no idea.

Alright, let's forget about Yoshi's House for now and play the first level, which has a "1", an "E", and a keyhole in its name. So, do those indicate it's the first easy level and has two exits? Maybe.
And, with the cape, I can make it back without getting nibbled again. Nice! Okay, let's ride one of Birdo's eggs over to the keyhole now.
Goal tape average so far: 40 / 1 = 40 stars each.
I guess this hack was made by someone called "PYUA", and it was requested to me by SuperAgentYoshi some time ago. However, there was an issue at the time...
Yep, I didn't let the screen scroll up enough to see this block the first time.
NOTE: Sacrifical horse count reset to 0.
Okay, there's the keyhole, but is the key further to the left?
BGM: Chrono Trigger - Corridors of Time
